page.title: 07Ballet in a Country Town
page.content: Elizabeth Corney began ballet dancing when she was four and was soon winning talent competitions.Later,when entry to ballet school eluded her,the love of dancing spurred her to open her own school in Lydney.Twenty six years on her success and popularity has made the School attract not only local children but others from as far away as Swindon and Pontypridd. Her most successful pupil was Julie Rose who began ballet at six.At eight she won a scholarship and at eleven successfully auditioned for the Royal Ballet School.Eventually she entered the Company and travels extensively, sometimes taking solo parts.She has been offered an open contract,the first offered to a lady dancer. Boys too attend the classes,one of whom,Andrew Buckley, also gained entry to the Royal Ballet School.
